html: Proud to support the Health Care Affordability Act, which will: Cut monthly premiums by more than $1k for average NY family making $110,000 Offer low-cost insurance to 22,000 uninsured people in #NY11 Cap premiums for individual market consumers at 8.5% of income
text:
Proud to support the Health Care Affordability Act, which will:

Cut monthly premiums by more than $1k for average NY family making $110,000

Offer low-cost insurance to 22,000 uninsured people in #NY11
Cap premiums for individual market consumers at 8.5% of income

html: Instead of tearing down the #ACA like the Administration continues to try to do, we must work to strengthen protections the ACA provides & continue the fight to provide more Americans with affordable health care options. The Health Care Affordability Act will do just that.
text:
Instead of tearing down the #ACA like the Administration continues to try to do, we must work to strengthen protections the ACA provides & continue the fight to provide more Americans with affordable health care options. 

The Health Care Affordability Act will do just that.

html: The Health Care Affordability Act will help improve the #ACA by increasing tax credits to make premiums more affordable while providing access for up to 9 million more Americans to qualify for lower-cost coverage.pic.twitter.com/fsSS758owM
text: The Health Care Affordability Act will help improve the #ACA by increasing tax credits to make premiums more affordable while providing access for up to 9 million more Americans to qualify for lower-cost coverage.pic.twitter.com/fsSS758owM

html: Today for #WomensHistoryMonth, I’m honoring Gwendolyn Brooks. html: We remember Vicente Juárez. El patriarca de una familia grande y muy unida, Vicente era un gran esposo, padre y abuelo de ocho nietos. Sus vecinos lo amaban por sus esfuerzos para eliminar el vecindario de dientes de león cada verano—algunos años con más éxito que otros.

html: It’s been a week since five people were killed in an act of gun violence in #Aurora. Seven days of shock. Seven days of mourning. And seven days of incredible strength by the families and our resilient community.
text: It’s been a week since five people were killed in an act of gun violence in #Aurora. Seven days of shock. Seven days of mourning. And seven days of incredible strength by the families and our resilient community.

html: Closely monitoring the horrifying news in #Aurora and am on my way home to be with neighbors. Too soon to know the full details of what has happened, but what I do know is Aurora is a strong community and we will get through this together. Thanks to first responders on the scene.

html: When it comes to men and women: same work, same pay. Period. Proud that every member of the Democratic Caucus has signed on to the Paycheck Fairness Act.
text: When it comes to men and women: same work, same pay. Period. Proud that every member of the Democratic Caucus has signed on to the Paycheck Fairness Act.

html: Women still only make about 80 cents every $1 earned by a man. That gap is even wider for women of color. Compared to white men, African American women are paid 61 cents, Latina Women are paid 53 cents, and Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander women are paid 62 cents.
text: Women still only make about 80 cents every $1 earned by a man. That gap is even wider for women of color. Compared to white men, African American women are paid 61 cents, Latina Women are paid 53 cents, and Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander women are paid 62 cents.

html: Critical consumer protections have been halted during this shutdown. Voted tonight to make sure we have properly funded identity theft reporting programs and to restart the popular National Do Not Call Registry... we need our federal employees back at work asap!
text: Critical consumer protections have been halted during this shutdown. Voted tonight to make sure we have properly funded identity theft reporting programs and to restart the popular National Do Not Call Registry... we need our federal employees back at work asap!

html: Tonight, I also voted to fund the Small Business Administration. Our local small businesses and entrepreneurs have been some of the hardest hit during the government shutdown...access to capital is down $90 million per day! Looking to the Senate to pass this funding bill now.
text: Tonight, I also voted to fund the Small Business Administration. Our local small businesses and entrepreneurs have been some of the hardest hit during the government shutdown...access to capital is down $90 million per day! Looking to the Senate to pass this funding bill now.

html: Once again, tonight I voted to re-open the Treasury Dept and IRS so that we can meet the needs of the American people. So critical that folks across #IL14 can get their tax refunds without delay! The Senate needs to bring this bipartisan bill to the floor for a vote now.
